english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurairah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Let none of you wish for death, nor call for it before it comes to him, for when one of you dies, his hope and his action are cut off, and life does not increase the believer except in goodness.'

english_translation: Narrated from Ayub from Ibn Sireen from Ubaidah: I heard Ali delivering a sermon, and he said: 'O Allah, I have become weary of them and they of me. I have become tired of them and they of me. So relieve me of them and relieve them of me. What prevents you wicked ones from dyeing this (his beard) with blood?' And he placed his hand on his beard.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali ibn Zaid ibn Judaan from al-Hasan from Said ibn Abi al-As: I watched Umar one night as he left for al-Baqi at dawn. I followed him. He hastened and I hastened until he reached al-Baqi where he prayed. Then he raised his hands and said: 'O Allah, my age has become advanced, my strength has weakened, and I fear disruption among my subjects. So take me back to You without weakness or blame.' He continued saying this until morning.

english_translation: Narrated from al-Zuhri from Ibn al-Musayyib or someone else: When Umar stayed at al-Bathaa, he gathered sand and spread his cloak over it, then lay down and raised his hands, saying: 'O Allah, my age has become advanced, my bones have become fragile, my strength has weakened, and I fear disruption among my subjects. So take me back to You without weakness or dereliction.' Then he came to Madinah, and before the month was ended, he died.
